title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: Lomond been spread at its base, its majestic features would have stood unrivalled among the mountains of Scotland.* The ascent may be made conveniently from the village of Lawers, where there is a good inn.

title: Scotland Picturesque and Traditional. A pilgrimage with staff and knapsack
author: Todd, George Eyre.
snippet: Some five miles eastward from Lawers, at Fenian, the road strikesinland for the hamlet of Fortingall in Glen Lyon, a couple of milesaAvay, where the oldest tree in Europe is to be seen.
